meanings.definition: A person who holds negative views or attitudes.
meanings.sent1: Some negativists always see the bad side of things.
meanings.sent2: Negativists often focus on what they don't like.
meanings.sent3: The negativists in the group always predict rain on sunny days.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a gathering of dark clouds, a storm of negativists.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the heavy presence of the negativists, casting shadows on every smile.

meanings.definition: A person who tends to be critical or pessimistic.
meanings.sent1: The negativists in the meeting criticized every idea presented.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a negativist because she always expected the worst.
meanings.sent3: The negativists at the party joked that the cake would taste terrible.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a cold wind, chilling the room with the tone of a negativist.
meanings.sent5: The negativists' presence loomed over the room, casting a shadow of doubt on every plan.

meanings.definition: A person who opposes or rejects certain ideas or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The negativists refused to accept the new policy changes.
meanings.sent2: Negativists often challenge traditional ways of thinking.
meanings.sent3: The negativists in the book club only wanted to read classic novels.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of ideas, the negativists were the weeds, choking out innovation.
meanings.sent5: Their voices echoed like thunder, the negativists' dissent shaking the foundation of the group's beliefs.
